item.title: Welcome
item.author: evans@virginia.edu (David Evans, Vladimir Kolesnikov and Mike Rosulek)
item.description: Welcome to the website for the Pavilion Seminar, “How will Artificial Intelligence change Humanity?". The seminar will be offered in Fall 2018, led by David Evans. Enrollment is by permission only, and strictly limited to 15 students (according to the Pavilion seminar rules).

item.title: A Pragmatic Introduction to Secure Multi-Party Computation
item.author: evans@virginia.edu (David Evans, Vladimir Kolesnikov and Mike Rosulek)
item.description: A Pragmatic Introduction to Secure Multi-Party Computation David Evans, Vladimir Kolesnikov and Mike Rosulek Secure multi-party computation (MPC) has evolved from a theoretical curiosity in the 1980s to a tool for building real systems today. Over the past decade, MPC has been one of the most active research areas in both theoretical and applied cryptography. This book introduces several important MPC protocols, and surveys methods for improving the efficiency of privacy-preserving applications built using MPC.
